intro: Alseodaphne semecarpifolia var. malabarica, commonly known as the Malabar alseodaphne, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to the Western Ghats of India and is characterized by its aromatic, evergreen leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces dark purple berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical forests. Due to its ecological significance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
